actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow a retirement savings deduction for persons covered by certain pension plans.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a deduction from the gross income of an employee who is a participant in a pension plan for cash contributions made by the employee to: (1) a qualified pension, profit sharing, or stock bonus plan; (2) a qualified annuity plan; (3) a qualified bond purchase plan; (4) an individual retirement plan; or (5) a group retirement trust maintained by a labor organization. Limits such deduction to ten percent of the employee's compensation for the taxable year or $1,000, whichever is less.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow a retirement savings deduction for persons covered by certain pension plans.
